item.title: Tree blocking view of oncoming traffic, 9th July
item.description:
When pulling out of Broadlands Road into Burnt Lane your view of traffic and especially bikes is blocked by the lower branches of the tree! This is a main road we are going onto and not being able to see cyclists coming along is very dangerous!! This tree is between Broadlands Road and the bus stop On Burnt Ash Lane!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bin & bag left on pavement & horse poo in road, 9th July
item.description:
First photo: Location is between No.19 Trenchard St. & the Hoskins St. end of the street: the small green rubbish bin & some contents was left on the pavement , about a month ago and remains & the bag and overflowing contents appeared on Monday, the day our rubbish is collected. Second photo: Between No.2 Trenchard St. & the Greenwich Park St. end of the street: you will see horse poo which appeared yesterday after I heard some police on horseback in the street. The poo was much worse this morning but I expect cars have driven over it since.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trenchard Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear Simon Priscilla,Denise corbin could you please address this issue of Osborne Road garages no parking restrictions causing antisocial behavior,blocking leaseholders and residents garages daily basis causing a nuisance,annoyance, antisocial behaviour to other leaseholders and residents not being able to access their garage door to get their vehicle out garage because of the Residence, relative has parked cars front of garage door causing obstruction. since the Osborne road barrier gate has been broke and not repaired. Leaseholders and residents are getting fed up of this get the gate fixed and do your job we pay our rent. Also Hackney council parking department has now made the car park a free-for-all parking causing anti-social behavior to leaseholders and residents. Some residents, lease holders are considering ending their garage tenancy because of this anti-social behavior and obstructions being caused due to Hackney council's behaviour. Hackney Council management team are causing alarm and distress to leaseholders and residents this is being going on for about two years and the council are not addressing these issues. I want leaseholders to pay their rent for their garage but they not addressing the issues being raised. Hackney Council causing anti-social behaviour., 9th July
item.description:
No enforcement parking restrictions in Osborne Road garages this is causing vehicle and to social behavior,obstruction of lease holders garages. This is due to Hackney Council management team not doing their duty incompetent workers.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mallard Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, 9th July
item.description:
The state of this cycle path is completely - and consistently - unacceptable. I use it every week and every single time there is broken glass absolutely everywhere. I‚Äôm surprised any cyclists actually use it - I would rather take my chances in the road. I don‚Äôt know who spends their weekends throwing bottles onto Vauxhall Bridge but it clearly needs a proper cleaning and enforcement schedule - not just sporadic sweeping. This is a major commuting route and instead of enabling active travel it is putting thousands of people off, costing cyclists money in puncture repairs and endangering our safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vauxhall Bridge, Vauxhall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
